Package io.dimeformat

Class Identity

java.lang.Object
io.dimeformat.Item
io.dimeformat.Identity
public class Identity extends Item
Represents an entity inside a network, or equivalent system. May be self-issued or issued by a trusted entity (and thus becomes part of a trusted chain).

      public static final String HEADER
      The item header for DiME Identity items.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • getHeader

      public String getHeader()
      Description copied from class: Item
      Returns the item header of the DiME item. This can be used to identify the type of DiME item held in this generic class. It is also used in the exported DiME format to indicate the beginning of a DiME item inside an envelope. Typically, this is represented by a short series of letters.
      Specified by:
      getHeader in class Item
      Returns:
      The item header of the DiME item.

    • getPublicKey

      public Key getPublicKey()
      Returns the public key attached to the identity of an entity. The Key instance returned will only contain a public key with the capability 'SIGN'.
      Returns:
      A Key instance with a public key with the capability 'SIGN'.

    • getCapabilities

      public List<IdentityCapability> getCapabilities()
      Returns a list of any capabilities given to an identity. These are requested by an entity and approved (and potentially modified) by the issuing entity when issuing a new identity. Capabilities are usually used to determine what an entity may do with its issued identity.
      Returns:
      An immutable list of Capability instances.

    • getPrinciples

      public Map<String,​Object> getPrinciples()
      Returns all principles assigned to an identity. These are key-value fields that further provide information about the entity. Using principles are optional.
      Returns:
      An immutable map of assigned principles).

    • getTrustChain

      public Identity getTrustChain()
      Returns the parent identity of a trust chain for an identity. This is the issuing identity.
      Returns:
      Parent identity in a trust chain.

    • isSelfIssued

      public boolean isSelfIssued()
      Returns if the identity has been self-issued. Self-issuing happens when the same entity issues its own identity.
      Returns:
      true or false

    • verify

      public IntegrityState verify​(Identity trustedIdentity, List<Item> linkedItems)
      Verifies the integrity and over all validity and trust of the item. The verification will be made using the public key in the provided identity. The verification will also check if the item has been issued by the provided identity, if the "iss" claim has been set. If the identity has a trust chain, then this will be taken into considerations while verifying.
      Overrides:
      verify in class Item
      Parameters:
      trustedIdentity - A trusted identity to verify with, may be from anywhere in the trust chain.
      linkedItems - A list of item where item links should be verified, may be null.
      Returns:
      The integrity state of the verification.

    • verify

      public IntegrityState verify​(Key verifyKey, List<Item> linkedItems)
      Description copied from class: Item
      Verifies the integrity and over all validity and trust of the item. If a key is provided, then verification will use that key. If verifyKey is omitted, then the local key ring will be used to verify signatures of the item.
      Overrides:
      verify in class Item
      Parameters:
      verifyKey - Key used to verify the item, may be null.
      linkedItems - A list of item where item links should be verified, may be null.
      Returns:
      The integrity state of the verification.

    • hasCapability

      public boolean hasCapability​(IdentityCapability capability)
      Will check if a particular capability has been given to an identity.
      Parameters:
      capability - The capability to check for.
      Returns:
      true or false.
